group.label: Attributes
group.comment: This section lists all of the available attributes which can be used to produce the Google Shopping feed. Some attributes are required by Google for all product types; whereas some are required for certain product types, such as apparel. To avoid errors in your Google Merchant account please make sure that you include all of the required attributes. More Information.

field.label: ID
field.comment: Select the attribute associated with the product ID. Use a unique value for each product. Suggested field: SKU

field.label: Name
field.comment: Select the attribute associate with the product name. This attribute needs to match the title of your product landing page. Suggested field: Product Name

field.label: Name: Conditional
field.comment: Read how to use conditional fields right here.

field.label: Name: Multiple
field.comment: Read how to use multiple fields right here.

field.label: Description
field.comment: Select the attribute associated with the product description. As required by Google the description will be truncated to a maximum of 5000 characters and stripped of html. Suggested field: Description

field.label: Description: Conditional
field.comment: Read how to use conditional fields right here.

field.label: Description: Multiple
field.comment: Read how to use multiple fields right here.

field.label: Source
field.comment: Select which image you would like to display for your product ad. It is recommended that you select all images if they are available, so that any additional images are also exported.

field.label: Main Image
field.comment: Select the source for the main image, other images will be exported as additional image(s).

field.label: Unique Product Identifiers
field.comment:
Regarding the Google Shopping requirements, manufactured products need to have a brand/manufacturer value and a matching unique identifiers as GTIN or MPN. When there is less than 2 of these values the "Identifier Exists = false" row will be automatically added into the feed for this product.
More Information.

field.label: GTIN
field.comment:
Required for all products with a GTIN assigned by the manufacturer. A GTIN is the numerical version of the bar code and identifies your product and needs to be unique for each product ID. Submit a GTIN as defined in the official GS1 validation guide.
More Information.

field.label: GTIN: Conditional
field.comment: Read how to use conditional fields right here.

field.label: GTIN: Multiple
field.comment: Read how to use multiple fields right here.

field.label: Brand
field.comment: Required for each product with a clearly associated brand or manufacturer.

field.label: Brand: Multiple
field.comment: Read how to use multiple fields right here.

field.label: MPN
field.comment: Required MPN is a unique identifier issued by the manufacturer. If you have the GTIN in your feed the MPN is not mandatory. Without a GTIN Google requires the MPN and Brand attribute.

field.label: MPN: Conditional
field.comment: Read how to use conditional fields right here.

field.label: MPN: Multiple
field.comment: Read how to use multiple fields right here.

field.label: Add Identifier Exists
field.comment: Automatically adds "Identifier Exists = false" when row condition is not met. Recommended to set this to Yes.

field.label: Product Condition
field.comment: Product condition is a required field for Google Shopping.

field.label: Default Value
field.comment: Select the default product condition. Only three options are supported: New, Refurbished and Used.

field.label: Attribute
field.comment: Use a custom attribute to use the product condition.

field.label: Product Category
field.comment:
The products are categorized in Google Shopping according to the Google product taxonomy. Use the most specific product category to meet the Google requirements. More Information.

Overwrite this value to specify the category.

group.label: Product Types
group.comment:
Configure the three different product types to make sure that you are using the right attribute values for the different product types.
More Information.

field.label: Configurable Products
field.comment: For configurable products, we recommend to only add the simple products to the configuration as a âconfigurable productâ by itself cannot be purchased. Choose the attribute(s) that you want to use from the parent relation configurable product.

field.label: Use Configurable/Simple Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Linked Simple Products. Selecting this option will export linked simple products that are part of a configurable product. This option is recommended so that the unique product variants are exported to the Google Shopping Feed.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes, with Auto-Link. In this way the URL will be automatically link to the correct simple product on the configurable product landing page.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if Empty. Selecting this option will export the parent image which will be used if there is no image available for a simple product.

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent configurable product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. In this way you only use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated als "normal" simple products without relations.

field.label: Bundle Products
field.comment: For Bundle Products, we recommend to only add the Bundle product by itself as this is the item that can be purchased.

field.label: Use Bundle Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Bundle Product. Selecting this option will export the bundle product by itself to the Google Shopping Feed.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. Selecting this option will export the URL that links directly to the Bundle Product.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if Empty. Selecting this option will export the parent image which will be used if there is no image available for a simple product

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent bundle product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. This selecting will use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated as "normal" simple products without relations.

field.label: Grouped Products
field.comment: For Group Products, we recommend to only add the Grouped Product by itself as that is the product that can be purchased.

field.label: Use Grouped Products
field.comment: Recommended: Only Grouped Product. Selecting this option will export the bundle product by itself to the Google Shopping Feed.

field.label: Use Parent URL for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. Selecting this option will export the URL that links directly to the Bundle Product.

field.label: Use Parent Image for Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Only if Empty. Selecting this option will export the parent image which will be used if there is no image available for a simple product

field.label: Use Parent Data for Simples
field.comment: Select the attributes that you want to use from the parent grouped product. It is not recommended to select the attributes that need to be unique for the simples, such as GTIN and Color.

field.label: Use Fallback only on Non Visible Simples
field.comment: Recommended: Yes. This selecting will use the logic for the attribute fallback and relations on simples with the visibility "Not Visible Individually". Simples that are visible in the catalog are treated as "normal" simple products without relations.

group.label: Additional Configuration
group.comment: Configure extra data Fields, Shipping information and Google Analytics Tracking.

field.label: Extra Fields
field.comment: You can add custom fields to your feed when needed. Please make sure that you are using the latest custom field standards to prevent error messages in the feed. The guidelines for the custom fields can be found in our knowledgebase.

field.label: Shipping Prices
field.comment: Add the shipping rates directly into the feed to meet the Google Merchant requirements. You can set different shipping costs based on the price range of products using the âFromâ and âToâ fields. Enter the shipping price for the range in the âPriceâ field.

field.label: Shipping Settings
field.comment: This calculation table sets the shipping costs based on a products price range. If you want to create more advanced rules using calculations based on country, category or weight, you can configure this directly in your Google Merchant account.

field.label: Google Analytics Tracking
field.comment: When you are using Google Analytics you can add your UTM tags eg. utm_source=googleshopping&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=googleshopping

field.label: Weight
field.comment: This is the weight of the product used to calculate the shipping cost of the item. If you have specified a global shipping method that is dependent on shipping weight (Merchant Dashboard), this attribute will be used to calculate the shipping cost of the item automatically.

group.label: Filter Options
group.comment: This option allows you to include/exclude products from the Google Shopping feed based on the product visibility or stock information.

field.label: Filter on Visibility
field.comment: Include or exclude products based on the visibility.

field.label: Only add products with the following Visibility
field.comment: Add products with the selected visibility.

field.label: Filter by Category
field.comment:
Include or Exclude products based on the category.

Note for Include:
Simple products within a bundled, configurable or grouped product are treated as own entities, so these should also be present in the included categories.

Note for Exclude:
Exclude the products from these categories. Products that are available within different categories need to be excluded from all of the categories they are assigned to.

field.label: Exclude Out of Stock
field.comment: Exclude products that are out of stock in your store.

field.label: Advanced Filters
field.comment: Configure the advanced filter using your attributes and different filter options.

group.label: Feed Generation Settings
group.comment: Each store view will have its own Google Shopping feed. You can easily enable or disable the Google Shopping feed generation on store level or automatically generate the Google Shopping feed. In case you are not using the Cronjob functionality it's possible to generate the Google Shopping feed manually.

field.label: Feed Generation
field.comment: Enable or disable the feed generation for this store view or change the filename.

field.label: Cron
field.comment: The Cronjob is a periodic script which is scheduled to automatically generate the Google Shopping feed based on the below frequency configuration. Please make sure that your default Magento Cronjob is working. If not, contact your hosting company for help.

field.label: Custom Frequency
field.comment: Enter frequency in Crontab format. E.g. 0 5, 17 * * * - this will generate the feed at 5AM and 5PM daily.

field.label: Products per Batch
field.comment: Use the paging function on big catalogs. For example, if your catalog contains 50.000 SKU, use 5.000 per page to split the feed run and lower the load. The products will be combined in one feed after the generation is complete.

field.label: Debug Memory Usage
field.comment: Write the memory usage to the var/log/googleshopping.log file
